objects.name: Jump Host
objects.description: Jump hosts are devices used to support remote management sessions into ICS networks or devices. The system is used to access the ICS environment securely from external networks, such as the corporate network. The user must first remote into the jump host before they can access ICS devices. The jump host may be a customized Windows server using common remote access protocols (e.g., RDP) or a dedicated access management device. The jump host typically performs various security functions to ensure the authenticity of remote sessions, including authentication, enforcing access controls/permissions, and auditing all access attempts.

x_mitre_related_assets.name: Intermediate System
x_mitre_related_assets.description: A Cyber Asset or collection of Cyber Assets performing access control to restrict Interactive Remote Access to only authorized users.(Citation: North American Electric Reliability Corporation June 2021)

external_references.source_name: North American Electric Reliability Corporation June 2021
external_references.description: North American Electric Reliability Corporation 2021, June 28 Glossary of Terms Used in NERC Reliability Standards Retrieved. 2021/10/11
